cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who has the most wins on around the horn
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
"Around the Horn" is a sports talk show that features various sports commentators competing in a panel format. The show awards points based on the quality of their arguments and performance, and the commentator with the most points at the end of the episode is declared the winner. Over the years, certain commentators have appeared more frequently and have accumulated more wins than others. 

To determine who has the most wins, one would typically look at the historical records of the show, which may include statistics on individual commentators' performances. As of my last knowledge update in October 2023, Tony Reali, the host, has often mentioned the standings of various panelists, and some commentators like Woody Paige and Jay Mariotti have been noted for their frequent wins.

However, to provide the most accurate answer, one would need to check the latest statistics or records from the show, as this information can change over time with new episodes and competitions.

Answer: As of October 2023, the commentator with the most wins on "Around the Horn" is likely Woody Paige, but for the most current and accurate information, checking the latest statistics or show records would be necessary.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who has the most wins on around the horn
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['"Around the Horn" premiered on November 4, 2002. From its premiere until January 30, 2004, the show was hosted by Max Kellerman, who at the time was largely known strictly as a contributor to ESPN\'s "Friday Night Fights". Kellerman departed from the network for Fox Sports and after the show tried out several replacements, current host Tony Reali was named the permanent host on February 2, 2004. As of August 2017, Woody Paige has the most wins in the history of the show, with more than five hundred. Despite early negative reviews due to its argumentative formatting, the show has lasted more than fifteen years on the air, remaining a staple on ESPN.\n', 'As of January 18, 2018, she has 36 wins on ESPN\'s "Around the Horn\n', 'Van Horn biggest online victory is third place in the $1,000 event of the 2002 World Championship of Online Poker.\n', 'As of October 30, 2014, Jones has 104 wins in 373 appearances on ESPN\'s "Around the Horn".\n', 'The Hawthorn Memorial Trophy has been awarded to the most successful British or Commonwealth Formula 1 driver every year since . Nigel Mansell and Lewis Hamilton have won the award the most times, taking the trophy on seven occasions each. The current holder is Lewis Hamilton, the World Champion.\n', 'Deidre Hall holds the most wins, winning in 1984, 1985 and 1995. Hall is followed by Kim Zimmer who won twice in 1988 and 2000.\n', 'In January 2014, Jones won three consecutive "Around the Horn" episodes in which he appeared.\n', "BULLET::::- Round 4 - Hawthorn's largest winning margin against (99 points)\n", "BULLET::::- Round 7 - Hawthorn's largest winning margin against (145 points)\n", "Golden Horn (foaled 27 March 2012) is a British-bred Thoroughbred racehorse who won The Derby and Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe in 2015. In a racing career which lasted 367 days from October 2014 until October 2015 he won seven of his nine races and was never beaten by a male horse. He was bred in England by his owner Anthony Oppenheimer and was trained throughout his racing career by John Gosden.\n"]

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.

question_info.question: who has the most wins on around the horn
passages:
"Around the Horn" premiered on November 4, 2002. From its premiere until January 30, 2004, the show was hosted by Max Kellerman, who at the time was largely known strictly as a contributor to ESPN's "Friday Night Fights". Kellerman departed from the network for Fox Sports and after the show tried out several replacements, current host Tony Reali was named the permanent host on February 2, 2004. As of August 2017, Woody Paige has the most wins in the history of the show, with more than five hundred. Despite early negative reviews due to its argumentative formatting, the show has lasted more than fifteen years on the air, remaining a staple on ESPN.
As of January 18, 2018, she has 36 wins on ESPN's "Around the Horn
Van Horn biggest online victory is third place in the $1,000 event of the 2002 World Championship of Online Poker.
As of October 30, 2014, Jones has 104 wins in 373 appearances on ESPN's "Around the Horn".
The Hawthorn Memorial Trophy has been awarded to the most successful British or Commonwealth Formula 1 driver every year since . Nigel Mansell and Lewis Hamilton have won the award the most times, taking the trophy on seven occasions each. The current holder is Lewis Hamilton, the World Champion.
Deidre Hall holds the most wins, winning in 1984, 1985 and 1995. Hall is followed by Kim Zimmer who won twice in 1988 and 2000.
In January 2014, Jones won three consecutive "Around the Horn" episodes in which he appeared.
BULLET::::- Round 4 - Hawthorn's largest winning margin against (99 points)
BULLET::::- Round 7 - Hawthorn's largest winning margin against (145 points)
Golden Horn (foaled 27 March 2012) is a British-bred Thoroughbred racehorse who won The Derby and Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe in 2015. In a racing career which lasted 367 days from October 2014 until October 2015 he won seven of his nine races and was never beaten by a male horse. He was bred in England by his owner Anthony Oppenheimer and was trained throughout his racing career by John Gosden.
